text: In English: Chuukese is the language of Chuuk state in Micronesia (country) with around 45.9k speakers, using the Latin alphabet with accents like: Áá, Éé, Óó, Úú, and Öö. It can be only found in Google Translate, a translator app called "English To Chuukese Translator, another translator app called "Glosbe", Freelang Dictionary, and a PDF by Jocelyn Howard from the University of Hawaii". Language family: Austronesian language family. Category:Micronesian languages
title: Chuukese language
